or something i don't need to lay this

it immediately undercuts it it's kind of
like they took mirai nikki and sanded
all the edges down and considering that
that show is 100% pure edge that leaves

mitigate that issue hand Shakers is
padded out with a lot of boring

much the entire second episode is spent
just watching characters sit at tables
and talk about the plot and a solid

and koi ori getting part-time jobs are
saving their classes school festival
booth from a last minute disaster it
feels like they wrote these episodes by

Chizu who is really happy except when

dinky wannabe idol who starts every
other sentence with quotes from foreign
dead guys in order to sound smart and
when i say every other sentence i mean
she does it 9 [ __ ] times in one

geoffrey thew once said thanks i hate it

after she's defeated we find out the

characters are frustrating enough on

tazuna and Cory's hand-shaker opponents

none of these characters go through any

the most significant emotional arc in

these inner monologues only regurgitate

he's putting the earth in danger I need
to protect the earth from him he's
strong though golly I sure did punch him
just now oh no now he punched me hand
Shakers is far from the only anime that

she mostly just stares off into the

story centers around ma ceruse obsession
with precious memories a real-world
japan-exclusive card game that lets you

deep that those license trading cards
are the weapons that Masaru uses to
fight in the ziggurat I am dead serious
good brand integration is a balancing
act between highlighting and products
best features and using them to
naturally further your plot you want to
weave the brand organically into your
story introduce it in a way that makes
sense given who the characters are and
what they're already doing what you
don't do is take a girl who will die in
two [ __ ] hours if she doesn't hold
her boyfriend's hand and have her sit
down to calmly watch a card game
tournament while he's frantically
searching the city for her I don't think
I have ever seen a more egregious
example of product placement just taking
over an anime storyline this is not how
you make people want to play a card game
man
this is today's video is sponsored by
Sai games and shadow vs. strategic
digital card game for mobile and PC that
is honestly one of my favorite things
that I've ever gotten
promote on this channel I've poured
countless hours and more money than I'd
care to admit into CCGs both physical
and digital over the years and shadow
versus one of the best I've played like
many of its competitors it takes
advantage of its video game elements to
do things like give your followers
persistent hit points and let them
summon cards that aren't in your deck
but thankfully it's not nearly as
reliant on RNG as some of the other
games I've played it has a ton of
strategic depth for experts to dive into
with a constantly updating meta thanks
to regular patches and pack releases
it's also super generous with drops you
get 50 booster packs just for finishing
the tutorial with more available through
events like the huge Mysteria friends
promotion they're running through the
end of march draft rewards and
single-player content so if you know
what you're doing you can build a
competitive deck without spending a cent
and without too much grinding but don't
let all that talk of strategy and expert
play scare you off if you're a card game
newbie who just likes all that gorgeous
anime art and wants to hear some voice
lines from their favorite Japanese or
English voice actors while they're
playing shadow verse offers surprisingly
meaty single-player campaigns for all
eight of its playable classes to help
you get familiar with their unique
mechanics and Sai game's sells decently
priced and decently built
pre-constructed decks that you can use
as a baseline to learn the ropes of deck
building and get a head start on your
card collection so if you've been
looking for a good card game to play and
all the other options just aren't anime
enough for you or you just want to play
a good game in general click the link in
the dooblydoo to give shadow versus shot
today that's how it's done hand shakers
step up but maybe i'm putting the cards
before the horse here you got to learn
to walk before you can run after all and
you got to learn to actually make a
watchable anime before you can use it to
sell things to people even ignoring the
terrible writing the terrible product
placement in the whole Shotokan incest
thing hand shakers is a hard show to
watch literally many baffling decisions
were made in the production design phase
of this show that make it difficult and
sometimes even painful just to point
your eyes at a screen that's playing it
and process that visual information with
your brain part of this problem is the
show's laughable CGI elements hand
shakers has some of the worst integrated
ugliest 3d
Cottle's I've ever seen in an anime yazi
and I are in the middle of watching
initial D stage two right now and the
interactions between the drivers and
their ps2 game model cars are more
convincing in that series from 1999 than
the interactions between the hand
shakers and their Nimrods in this one
from 2016 2d characters move at 12 or
sometimes 8 frames per second while the
weapons in their hands and the
backgrounds behind them seem to be
animated at 30 and between sneaking
chains spinning gears and particle
effects mothered trading cards those
weapons never ever stop moving this
constant smooth motion clashes with the
stuttering anime visuals and breaks the
illusion of movement that the show is
trying to achieve altogether leaving you
instead with the impression of watching
an anime style slideshow on a webpage
covered with Geo cities gifts and the
background art behind all of that noise
is no better hand shakers world is built
in part from poorly edited real-world
photographs and in part from CGI sets
that wouldn't look out of place in a
steam greenlight game and I honestly
can't tell you which of the two is
uglier the photo backgrounds are gussied
up digital recoloring zuv what appear to
be Google Street View screenshots with
exaggerated lens distortion effects
applied in post to disguise how awful
they really look the shots that utilize
these backgrounds give off the distinct
impression of wandering through the
streets of Osaka while blindingly drunk
which is coincidentally the state that
the background artists appear to have
been in when they slap together the
show's 3d CG environments almost every
interior scene in hand shakers is
rendered in computer generated 3d by
people who don't seem to know what the
inside of a house actually looks like or
how space works look at any room in this
series for more than a few seconds and
your mind will begin fracturing as you
try to comprehend how say the top of a
closet can exist when it backs on to the
landing of a staircase that's shorter
than it or why there seems to be a two
foot gap between that landing and the
rest of the stairs leading up to the
second floor or why the door to Lily's
bedroom is just kind of pasted onto the
wall instead of being set into a
doorframe or why professor Maki Hara has
20 copies of the same 15 books on his
shelves or how nah go because chair is
supposed to fit under his
or why the gaze of the great old ones is
piercing okay yep I looked at it too
long none of this feels as if it was
crafted with any kind of intent or
cohesive vision behind it rather it
looks like it was cobbled together from
store-bought models the anime equivalent
of a unity asset flip and it really
doesn't help that all of the models they
bought looked like they were lifted
straight from the pre-rendered cutscenes
of an early ps2 game with their flat
plasticy unshaded textures nothing in
these environments looks like it belongs
with anything beside it and that being
the case it should come as no surprise
when I say that the anime characters in
front of those mismatched 3d models
blend in with them about as well as oil
does with water it's not like this kind
of mix between CGI and traditional
animation can't look good from fate/zero
details of zestiria you photo Bowl has
proven time and again that in the right
hands it can be stunning but the secret
sauce that makes those shows work is the
studio's compositing team who spent
countless hours tuning scene lighting
particle effects and color grading in
order to bridge the gap between
hand-drawn and computer-generated
imagery and blend them into a single
cohesive picture go hands went for a
cheaper less time-consuming approach
with hand shakers they threw God Ray's
[ __ ] everywhere and slathered the
screen with rainbow vomit gradient
filters because if you can't make the
lighting on your characters and sets
look believable you can at least make it
look consistently terrible I could keep
finding things to rag on here all day
like the rapidly moving clouds in the
sky which make it look like the cities'
constantly being bombarded with Mach 5
storm winds but I think you get the idea
at this point from a technical
perspective hand shakers is an absolute
mess top to bottom go hands is simply
not equipped to handle their own visual
style but the embarrassing
over-ambitious cgi isn't really hand
shakers downfall the bigger problem is
what it enables with almost everything
but the characters themselves being 3d
objects hand shakers is free to move its
camera around how when and wherever it
pleases and you know that old saying
just because you can do something
doesn't mean you should well apparently
nobody at go hands ever heard it because
hand shakers uses 3d camera
for every action scene every
establishing shot almost every dramatic
moment and a good chunk of its dialogue
scenes to the camera doesn't need to be
looking up president Lily's nose while
she walks over to Tao sauna it doesn't
need to circle around his back while
she's talking to him
but it can so it does even though it
creates an unnerving disorienting effect
for the viewer speaking of unnerving and
disorienting please enjoy this footage
of coy Orie sobbing as she invades your
personal space the loose animated style
that's necessary for these 3d scenes is
oddly reminiscent of the cutscenes from
the CDI zelda games which is not
something that any animated production
should ever strive to be compared to
this lack of directorial restraint is
felt the hardest in the show's fight
scenes where the camera swings about
wildly sometimes changing angles
completely or zooming down entire city
blocks and back again in less than a
second there is zero sense that these
characters are really fighting each
other in a physical space it looks more
like they're wiggling around in front of
a bad screensaver and that's if you can
see what's happening at all depending on
how you're watching the series these
fight scenes can render it literally
unwatchable and I do mean literally with
the camera flipping out and particle
effects all over the place any degree of
streaming compression whatsoever turns
your screen into a pixelated jumble I
didn't just buy this blu-ray for the
sake of a one-off gag I actually needed
it to be able to watch the show at all
so move over promise of uncensored
titties technical incompetence is the
new wave and blu-ray marketing or maybe
not judging by how this sold after all
it's not like being able to actually see
what's going on and this show improves
the viewing experience at all if you
could strip away all of the technical
issues the stuttery erratic camera
movement the animation errors and the
awful character acting it would only
make these 3d tracking shots nicer to
look at it wouldn't fix the underlying
issue that this is bad cinematography
and direction it's not like the vast
majority of anime and
in general for that matter limit their
camera movement simply because 3d
tracking shots are harder to do
conventional static wide and close shots
standard camera moves like tilts pans
and zooms these things are commonplace
because over the course of more than a
century film makers have found that they
are often the best tools for the job
in telling the stories that they want to
tell we have developed a whole cinematic
language that is widely understood by
audiences around the world and maybe
it's appropriate that hand shakers make
so many references to the Tower of Babel
because it tries its hardest to pretend
like that universal language never even
existed to be clear there is nothing
inherently wrong with utilizing crazy
unconventional cinematography and
pushing the boundaries of what's
possible in animation in fact I'd say
it's a noble ambition rules are made to
be broken especially in art but if
there's no narrative purpose behind
those decisions if you're only breaking
those rules to look cool the end result
will at best feel empty and at worst it
will turn out to be a befuddling
incoherent mess it really seems like
hand shakers is only doing things
differently for the sake of being
different and I guess the intent behind
that is to make it seem like a work of
strong creative vision that could only
come from go hands but to me the loud
confused misdirected stylistic
flourishes only scream that there's no
real vision behind it at all there are
some things about the show that I do
actually like the motion graphics of
classical Japanese paintings and random
CGI koi fish that are projected onto the
backgrounds and the ziggurat are
distinctive and surreal and I can
genuinely say that I've never seen
anything like them before which is
exactly what I want to see when a show
is trying to take me to another world
it's just a shame that that other world
has nothing else going on it is
basically just an empty City and I think
that some of the musical compositions in
the OST are pretty damn catchy I mean
none of them are used correctly the main
battle track is a smooth jazz number
that wouldn't sound out of place as the
walking around town music in a persona
game so in a vacuum might say it's not
that but I keep having to qualify my
praise for these elements because they
don't exist in a vacuum
they're all components of a terrible
anime with no
proper sense of direction and without
that vision there inevitably squandered
by poor execution hand shakers is
without question one of the worst anime
I've ever had the displeasure of
watching and it might actually have been
the hardest one to sit through quite
often it is laughably inept but a little
too much of its runtime is excruciating
ly boring for it to really work as a fun
ironic hate watch by virtue of being the
first show that I've watched in my hunt
for the greatest mistake hand shakers
gets to claim the number one spot by
default for now but I've got a feeling
that it would have made its way to the
top no matter when I watched it and it's
gonna be the bad anime to beat for a
long time coming or maybe I'm just
hoping that it will because I don't know
how many more shows this bad I can
handle I want to say thank you once
again to shad overs for being kind
enough to sponsor this video I don't
ever do sponsorships for products that I
don't really like but it's nice to be
able to shill for one that I really
truly love and I'm excited at the
prospect of seeing some of you basement
dwellers online in the next few days my
user name is Anna Mae Pope so if you
destroy me on ladder or in an arena duel
hit me up on Twitter and let me know
also let me know in the comments below
what the worst anime you've ever seen is
and why and make sure you subscribe to
follow my quest for the greatest mistake
which I'm planning to continue on a
roughly monthly basis from now on I'm
also planning to highlight some good old
shows to balance out the bad so if
you're looking for more positive takes
on anime I love stick around they aren't
going anywhere but I am for now at least
I'm Jeff thew professional shitbags
signing out from my mother's basement
